page.title: 09LES MIELLES DEVELOPMENT
page.content:
Le Parcq des Mielles Development Plan has been going on for the past seven years. In 1978 the States of Jersey agreed to designate most of the land bordering St Ouen's Bay to the "view line" as conservation, recreation or agricultural areas. The idea was to make sure that the area was maintained as an attraction to tourists and the local population alike.
The main attraction of the area is the beach itself and there is a need for plenty of parking spaces. However when onshore winds are blowing there are lots of people who use the nearby sand dunes for sheltered sunbathing and picnics. This has caused problems because people and cars have caused damage to the dunes and their wildlife.
